actors.name: bullet5
actors.text: The main goal of tobacco companies is to make money and persuade people to use their products.

actors.name: bullet1
actors.text: In 2011, in the state of Wisconsin alone, about how much money did tobacco companies spend on marketing their products?

args.name: bullet1
args.text: No, actually it's way more. Tobacco companies spent about 145 million dollars in 2011 just in Wisconsin!

args.name: bullet1
args.text: No, actually it's way more. Tobacco companies spent about 145 million dollars in 2011 just in Wisconsin!

args.name: bullet1
args.text: You're right! That's a lot of money!

actors.name: main_text
actors.text: Tobacco use is the leading preventable cause of disease, disability, and death in the United States.

actors.name: bullet1
actors.text: According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, or the CDC, cigarette smoking results in about how many premature deaths in the United States each year?

args.name: bullet1
args.text: Nope, the correct answer is 480,000. That's a lot of deaths that could have been prevented!

args.name: bullet1
args.text: Nope, the correct answer is 480,000. That's a lot of deaths that could have been prevented!

args.name: bullet1
args.text: You're right! That's a lot of deaths that could have been prevented.
